intro: Lactuca sativa var. crispa, commonly known as curly endive, is a leafy vegetable characterized by its ruffled, crinkled leaves. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is cultivated for its edible, slightly bitter leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers cool climates with well-drained soil. Its leaves are often used in salads or cooked dishes, adding a unique texture and flavor. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties, including potential anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits.
